description.narrative: Strengthening Integrated Sustainable Landscape Management in Enga Province Papua New Guinea

activity-description.narrative: Project targeting Enga Province to increase sustainable and inclusive economic development of the Province in PNG.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output Indicators:
Indicator 1: A number of best practices on inclusive and integrated landscape approach in Enga province of Papua New Guinea Indicator 2: Agricultural, forests and pastoral ecosystems where sustainable management practices have been introduced (ha) Indicator 3: Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions avoided (tonnes CO2eq) with EU support and Carbon sequestered (tonnes CO2) Indicator 4: A number of jurisdictions to integrate climate change adaptation / DRM and climate change mitigation into development planning, PIP, DSIP application process; Indicator 5: A number of capacity building trainings for provincial and district stakeholders on land use planning Indicator 6: A number of policies, regulations and plans on sustainable land use management at the national, provincial and district levels Indicator 7: A number of men and women are informed about climate change impacts and developed options for adaptation and mitigation Indicator 8: A number of High Conservation Value (HCV) and High Carbon Stocks (HCS) Risk Maps for Enga province Indicator 9: A number of provincial based climate change adaptation and mitigation initiatives supported Indicator 10: Number of smallholders reached with EU supported interventions aimed to increase their sustainable production, access to markets and/or security of land Indicator 11: Number of people in food insecurity and food crises reduced Indicator 12: A multi-stakeholder Coffee Platform in Enga Province to strengthen private sector partnerships Indicator 13: Number of small-scale farmers adopting sustainable and resilient agriculture practices accompanied by research entities Indicator 14: A number of beneficiaries (including women) increased their awareness on the use of sustainability standards for coffee production as well as capacity for traceability of coffee through supply chain Indicator 15: A number of policy and regulations to support Sustainable Coffee Production at the national and provincial levels

comment.narrative:
Output Indicators:
1. 0 2. 0 3. 0 4. 0 – in 2020 neither Enga Province nor any districts have climate change or DRR strategies in place 5. 0 6. 0 7. 0 8. 0 9. 0 10. 0 – smallholders have very limited access to extension services and support 11. Assessment to be undertaken at start of project 12. 0 13. 0 – there has been limited community outreach and advocacy in the province 14. 0 15. 0 16. 0 17. 0 18. 0 19. 0 – there has been limited action on land restoration 20. 0 21. 0

1. 0 1. 5 2. 10,000ha 3. 50,000tCO2e 4. One provincial development plan including DRR/CC strategies and 3 District plans including DRR/CC strategies endorsed by Provincial Executive Council 5. 10 6. 5 7. 10,000 (including 3,000 women) 8. 3 9. 3 10. 2,000 smallholders 11. 10,000 12. 1 13. 2,000 14. 10,000 (3,000 women) 15. 1 16. 3 17. 30 18. 3 19. 5,000ha – 2,500ha through reforestation, 2,500ha through sustainable agriculture 20. 10,000 (3,000 women) 21. 5
Resources Mobilized. Contribution Agreement Signed with EU.

TARGETS FOR 2021: 1. A feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on climate change, land use, agriculture as well as forestry carried out and recommendations considered for project implementation. 2. A Memorandum of Understanding to integrate climate change into provincial development planning framework signed and implemented 3. At least 50 representatives (30% female) of the provincial government benefited from the trainings on sustainable integrated landscape approach 4. A small grant disbursement facility established and at least three community-based projects on climate change supported 5. At least 4 case studies/success stories produced and widely disseminated 6. At least 2 community-based projects on climate change mitigation and adaption supported through the small grant facility
TARGETS FOR 2021: 7. A feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on subsistence/family agriculture and recommendations considered for project implementation 8. At least 200 farmers and women groups benefited from capacity building trainings on climate resilient approaches and agricultural techniques 9. At least 3 best practices with small-scale family enterprises on the production of vegetable crops and access to finance
TARGETS FOR 2021: 10. A feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on subsistence/family agriculture and recommendations considered for project implementation 11. At least 50 environmental officers strengthened their knowledge on conservation monitoring 12. At least 2 community-based projects on land/forest ecosystems conservation projects through small grants facility 13. At least 3 best practices with on community conservation initiatives and media products
TARGETS FOR 2021: 14. PEB meetings 15. Annual and quarterly work plans prepared on time 16. Level of fund disbursement (over 85%) 17. Timely submitted Annual programme and financial reports

Results for 2021: 1. A firm was contracted for conducting the feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on climate change, land use, agriculture as well as forestry carried out and recommendations considered for project. The contract was delayed due to inability to find suitable candidates. The contract will be implemented in completed by Q2 2022. 2. A Memorandum of Understanding to integrate climate change into provincial development planning framework is drafted and is under review of the provincial government. 3. The capacity building consultants for all three components are hired who are developing the training material that will be delivered in 2022 to the target beneficiaries. 4. The small grants disbursement facility is established and had three rounds of announcement. There were two successful grantees in October round. There are other potential grantees in November and December rounds. 5. Two stories developed on the successful grantees. The project is also developing three animated videos covering project activities and for increased awareness raising about the project. 6. Two community-based projects on climate change mitigation and adaptation are supported through small grants facility.
Results for 2021: 7. A firm was contracted for conducting the feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on climate change, land use, agriculture as well as forestry carried out and recommendations considered for project. The contract was delayed due to inability to find suitable candidates. The contract will be implemented in completed by Q2 2022. 8. The capacity building consultants for all three components are hired who are developing the training material that will be delivered in 2022 to the target beneficiaries. 9. The project is supporting agriculture development through small grants. The best practices will be developed next year.
Results for 2021: 10. A firm was contracted for conducting the feasibility assessment of Enga landscape to determine baseline level on climate change, land use, agriculture as well as forestry carried out and recommendations considered for project. The contract was delayed due to inability to find suitable candidates. The contract will be implemented in completed by Q2 2022. 11. The capacity building consultants for all three components are hired who are developing the training material that will be delivered in 2022 to the target beneficiaries. 12. Two community-based projects on climate change mitigation and adaptation are supported through small grants facility. 13. The project is supporting agriculture development through small grants. The best practices will be developed next year.
Results for 2021: 14. Two Project Steering Committee meetings were organized. 15. Annual and quarterly work plans were prepared on time. 16. Over 85% was committed and utilized in 2021. 17. All annual and quarterly reports are submitted on time.
